titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1195

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Covington July 27. 1865
Hon. T. E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Dear Governor. Yours of yesterday is at hand.

It is greatly to be regretted that your engagements prevent you from coming here. Can't you be here on Friday or Saturday the 4th or 5th. You can do great good, besides the people here who are your friends desire to give you a demonstration here. I hope you will reconsider the matter and come if possiblye Saturday night. That will give you time Come down in the evening train, you can go to Lousiville Sunday evening and be at home Monday morning.
Do come if possible, and answer immediately
